security: Releasing information about liaison checks, even if no operational interest is shown, could expose the CIA's methods for gathering information and potentially compromise relationships with liaison services. Quoting: 'NO OBJECTION LIAISON CHECKS PROVIDE NO OPERATIONAL INTEREST SHOWN.'
summary: A message requesting liaison checks on Hersey Yamada, a photographer who traveled extensively in Asia and Mexico, specifying that there is no objection to the checks if no operational interest is shown.
summary_one_paragraph: This secret classified message, dated December 15, 1963, requests liaison checks from MEXI (Mexico City), MANILA, and HONG KONG on Hersey Yamada, a California-born photographer who worked for Agence France Presse and traveled in Japan, Manila, and the Bosphorus between 1956-62, specifying that the checks are permissible if no operational interest is revealed.
title: Request for Liaison Checks on Hersey Yamada
